captions.text:
- Come on, take the ticket.
We're busy here.
- # And the lady is mine ##

Come on, take the ticket.
Take it.

[ Duke Narrating ] There is
no way of explaining the terror l felt.

- ## [ Continues ]
- [ On P.A. ] Attention,
all Mint Hotel guests.

Will the owner
of a green Pinto...

[ Duke Narrating ]
l was pouring sweat.

My blood is too thick
for Nevada.

l've never been able to properly
explain myself in this climate.

[ Duke Narrating ]
Okay. Be quiet, be calm.

...hamburger stand.
She was a waitress about 16 years old.

They chopped her goddamn head off right
there in the parking lot...

and cut all kinds of holes in her
and sucked out the blood.

They were after the pineal gland,
l think. Yeah.

- No. How's your mama ?
- [ Duke ] Ignore this terrible drug.

[ Muttering ] On the list.
Freelance. On the list, then ?

and l realize that his name
is not on that list...

but we must have
a suite !

but someone
was looking for you.

Aah ! No ! We haven't done
anything yet !

This man suffers
from a bad heart.

But l have plenty of medicine.
My name is Dr. Gonzo.

Prepare our suite at once.
We'll be in the bar.

[ Woman ] l don't know about you,
but l'm startin' to feel that drink.

Hey, beat it.
Beat it. Go on.

[ Woman ]
l like the way you did that.

Come on.
Come on. Come on.

- What's that ?
- Come on, come on.
Let's get some peanuts.

That's one thing
that's good for you. Peanuts.

- Two Cuba libres, beer
and mescal on the side.
- You got it.

- [ Man ] l'll bet you're a Libra.
- Mmm.

Who's Lacerda ? He's waiting
for us on the 12th floor.

- The name rang a bell,
but l couldn't concentrate.
- [ Gurgling, Bubbling ]

Terrible things were happening
all around us.

otherwise we'll never
get out of this place alive.

lmpossible to walk
in this muck.

[ Woman On P.A. ]
Mr. Roger Pratt, please
call the hotel operator.

title: Fear and Loathing in Las Vegas (3/10) Movie CLIP - The Hotel on Acid (1998) HD

comments.author: shschesschamp

comments.text:
Having done acid three times, I must say: what you see at the one minute 
mark is SCARY close to what you actually see while on the drug. The visual 
"unlayering" (if you will), of the patterns in the carpet would separate 
eerily just as it would as shown. Who is the cinematographer for this 
movie? Brilliant stuff! This guy did his homework!﻿

comments.author: Blakeb903

comments.text:
I watched this movie one night when I did a bunch of dmt powder and 
etizolam. I ended up blacking out half way threw the movie took my last 
morphine shot I was saving and ended up handing out 200 bucks worth of my 
shrooms. Sucked because I couldn't remover shit all I Remember was starting 
to trip then the etizolam kicked hard I bet it was an awsome time tho 
everyone said I was talking in some strange language that I made up and 
that I was stuck in my chair and started freaking out because I guess I 
thought I was glued to the chair. My friend said that he carried out like a 
half and hour conversation of just weird ass sounds lol. Ah the days when I 
use to get high. It was always fun when I had drugs, but when they were 
gone I just couldn't live. If it was entirely for me getting to a clnic and 
changing everything around ide be dead or in prison. I miss making the 
money I did tho, but my wife ended up pregnate and my son became more 
important than anything else to me. To all of you out there still stuck in 
a life that consumes with addiction there is a way to change everything can 
get better and I promise in just 90 days of sobriety your life will change 
beyond belief good day everyone.﻿

comments.author: Aaronlcyrus

comments.text:
I was on mushrooms the first time I watched this and it was quite 
weird……but entertaining and often fun.  Johnny Depp nailed the Hunter 
character and in hindsight some of the violence tinged scenes with Dr. 
Gonzo were a bit uncomfortable…..which is simply a reflection of the human 
mind and condition.  Honestly who wouldn't experience some weirdness and 
paranoia in a place like Vegas?  We all have our shadow side and the use of 
powerful plant compounds in a proper setting is an invaluable tool to 
experiencing the inner depths of oneself and how we relate to this 
experience called life.﻿

comments.text:
PANCAKES FOR YOU

Fresh, steaming, light and fluffy,
Hot from the pan after being cooked just right,
Topped with a glistening pat of melted butter
And drizzled with cooling strands of sweet maple syrup;
I have prepared some delicious pancakes
For you.

These aren't just any normal run of the mill pancakes you know.
My pancakes are so special that once you've eaten them – and you will eat 
them
Once you've eaten my very special pancakes it will be like a warm glowing 
ball of wonderful air,
Like the breath of an ether drunken angel misting into an exquisite cloud 
of amber luminescence
Within your belly, glowing and rising like a floating high that will make 
you say Oh!
What wonders have these pancakes delivered to me!
And how could I have ever lived without them, these transcendent and 
beautiful pancakes
Of the ages...

For you see there are some things in life that are not for the majority of 
mankind to know,
But rather for a select few, chosen by... who knows? Providence? Fate? 
Divine Will?
It is not for me to say what constellation of existential forces arrayed
For me to choose to share my pancakes with you,
Only to say that share them with you I shall
My pancakes
For you

You should also know that many lives were lost in order for you to have 
these pancakes
In fact, whole civilizations rose and fell
All in the service of developing the exact, precise, and minutest of 
ingredients,
A combination of tastes and textures and smells and even sounds
So vast as to form a fractal replication of the soul
That resonates across the reverberations of history...
The voices of an infinite choir singing the praises of my holiest of fluffy 
delicious pancakes
Pancakes that are so MMMMM good interweaving through the fabric of time and 
space
And delicately caressing the lips of existence
And the gently, whimsically tippy toeing their way
Into the stomach of Love

And so there you go.
Pancakes for you.
Eat them now
And enjoy forever﻿
